intro: Compsoneura mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican flatleaf cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its flat, ribbed stems that store water. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent structure. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in desert ecosystems.
